The location was excellent‚Äîvery central and convenient for getting around. The bedroom was cozy and clean, making it a pleasant space to relax in. Hanh was a very responsive host and helpful throughout the stay, which made things much easier. However, the mattress was a bit too firm for my liking, which affected the comfort slightly. Also, just a heads-up for future guests: the entrance to the property is through a clothing store, which was a bit unexpected at first but manageable once you get used to it. Overall, a decent stay with great location value and a helpful host!
had a great stay! The place was clean, comfortable, and exactly as described. Hanh was helpful and responsive, which made everything smooth. I‚Äôd definitely recommend it to others
We stayed for two nights. Everything was very clean and pleasant. The design of the room was very cosy and welcoming. Since it was a side alley it was quiet for a big city.

Cool spot! Lovely vibe in the room, A/C, water bottles / tea / instant coffee provided. Walkable location to plenty of stuff in HCMC.
Things to note: You have to walk through a clothing store to get to the room (side door only).
Entire bathroom is a shower; rubber shower shoes are provided. You will spray water all over the toilet seat. It was novel to shower not in a booth/tub.
Bed is firm firm. I liked it personally.
Overall five stars!

Great stay! Very pretty cosy place. It is a little strange having to enter through a shop I must say, but aside from that it was very good. The location is also excellent, walking distance of everything.

She was very helpful and responded almost immediately. Her place was beautifully decorated. The location is perfect and there is lots to do and to explore near by. We felt right at home. Would come back any time.

The security was outstanding, discreet and yet very attentive and watchful, always ready to smile and open the door - he even leant my friend and iPhone charger! The hosts are amazing, they work as a team and there is always someone available even reaching out to me at 3am after a late booking. Cheap Grab taxis can take you to the most popular parts of the city quite quickly; you'll likely need to use them, but darting around by Grab is the local culture and as you'll be doing that anyway it's better to stay somewhere a bit quiet I think.

Absolutely loved staying here, our host made sure everything was perfect and checked in regularly if we needed anything extra.
Thank you again ‚ò∫Ô∏è

The place is quite small and best suited for a solo traveler like me. Although it‚Äôs located in District 1, it feels a bit far from the main areas. However, bus stops are nearby, requiring a 6‚Äì10 minute walk. The accommodation provides basic amenities, and the host is very responsive, which is a big plus. One issue I noticed was the presence of small insects in the restroom and mosquitoes in the bed area, which can be bothersome if you‚Äôre sensitive to bugs. Also, there are no windows, which might make the space feel a bit suffocating, especially if you‚Äôre staying for more than a few days. However, you can go up to the rooftop to get some fresh air and enjoy a view of the neighborhood, which is a nice breather and a good place to relax for a while. Despite these minor concerns, the stay was decent overall. If you‚Äôre looking for a budget-friendly option for a short trip, this place is okay for a quick stay. It‚Äôs not perfect, but for the price, it‚Äôs a reasonable choice.

We had a wonderful stay at this Airbnb in Saigon. The place was incredibly cosy and had such a warm, homely vibe that made us feel right at ease. Everything was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated, with lovely plants that added a refreshing touch.
Being on the top floor, the apartment offered stunning views and a serene atmosphere that perfectly captured the Saigon vibe. The bathtub and hot water were a delight, making it easy to relax after a day of exploring. The AC worked perfectly, and the kitchenette was great for making morning coffee.
Overall, a fantastic place to stay! Highly recommended for anyone looking for a comfortable and charming base in Saigon.

Charming studio in an alley off the main road. If you want a true locals experience with modern amenities, this is the place for you. Ha was very helpful and answered my questions on the Airbnb home very promptly. Ha even went the extra mile and answered my question late at night when I needed some help, and that I really appreciate.
The home is tucked in a small alley above a cafe, but despite that it was generally very quiet and private which was honestly better than I expected. There are some nice restaurants nearby and street food is just a minute walk away.
The key point for me was the location. It's really close to the airport so it helps alleviate some of my anxiety with flight check-in scheduling.
Overall the amenities were in good condition, the light switches did get a bit confusing for me but nothing that couldn't be solved by asking Ha. Overall would stay again!

Ha is an amazing host and always just a message away. If we had any questions, Ha was always there to help. The apartment has a great location, very close to the airport, making it perfect for a long layover. It's located in a small alley, so it's quiet. And there are some interesting restaurants and coffee places nearby.
One tricky thing is the stairs to the second floor; they're a bit steep and can get slippery after rain, so heads up. If you have luggage, the staff from the cafe on the first floor can help you get it to the second floor. Also, the check-in and check-out are easy and smooth since the keys are available for pick up at the cafe on the first floor.
Overall, it's a great pick for the money for a few days before the flight. And thank you, Ha, for being a very responsive and helpful host. Best of luck to you!
Good and simple place, host was really helpful and replies really fast! Staff at the coffee shop was also really helpful in assisting on arrival.
Very local neighborhood away from the over crowded and touristy spots in Saigon!
‚ÄúLovely stay! The apartment was clean and cozy, with a cute caf√© right downstairs. Super convenient location, just a short drive from the airport. Highly recommend!‚Äù

This place is in the ideal location, inside the Cafe Apartments Mall. The room is more spacious than I thought, and it‚Äôs pretty clean (given Vietnamese standards for restroom). Great overall experience. Good communication and flexibility. I am quite sensitive to sound so there is some noise around the apartment, just don't expect absolute silence. But it was totally fine. Would rent again.

The apartment was perfect. I felt right at home. In a busy area, but surprisingly quiet inside. AC was amazing. The shower was hot. Everything was very clean. I would add a hot plate for cooking, but other than that no complaint. The host was very responsive. They answered me right away everytime I had a question. I highly recommend this place. I will be back in a few weeks and hopefully will be able to rent again!

The famous Cafe Apartments is located right in the centre of Saigon literally down the street from the the French-built town hall, around the corner from the Opera House, across the boulevard from the infamous Vietnam War-era Rex Hotel, down the street from the city's newest icon the Bitexco Tower and the Saigon River.
The apartment itself seems like the only available apartment that can be rented in the whole building making it a unique stay while the building is full of small restaurants/cafes.
The apartment is located on the second floor with great high ceilings and designed in a Studio/one bedroom layout, with kitchenette, small oven, fridge, wardrobes and great aircon. Bathroom is very small with a shower next to the toilet. Lounge. There were toiletries available. Balcony views are of a cramped alleyway. The only windows/natural light are from the front door.
The small elevator up costs 3000 Dong to use however I elected to walk up the 2 flights of stairs for the exercise.
Great host, friendly, quick communication, and very helpful. The building could be cleaner, and the lift requires payment to use.
I really like Nu apartment at Ben Nghe, walkable and very spacious. The host is very friendly. Really worth the price!
Apartment is on a great location, in a historic building, in the heart of the city. Great mattress, so I slept long and comfortable. Friendly host.

Our three-week stay at this Airbnb was absolutely wonderful, thanks to the incredible host and his lovely family. From the moment we arrived, they were welcoming, friendly, and quick to respond to any questions. Their helpfulness made our trip smoother and more enjoyable.
The property was exactly as pictured‚Äîstylish, spotless, and very comfortable. It‚Äôs clear a lot of care went into making it feel like a home away from home. We especially appreciated how well-equipped the space was‚Äîwe had everything we needed.

Cheap and cheerful, good bed, very clean. It‚Äôs a great location, safe and friendly down a quiet little lane but right in the middle of everything.  The keyless entry system was super helpful because my flight didn‚Äôt land until after 1am. Great communication throughout. There‚Äôs a little cafe just opposite the entrance. It doesn‚Äôt look posh but the food is really good.

I‚Äôm very low maintenance, but the week I stayed here, I struggled and ended up staying elsewhere for two nights. The location is right by the party street so that is convenient if you‚Äôre looking for that. I loved that 7/11, family mart and grocery store and bus stations were all steps away. The room had the bare essentials. Only one outlet with two plugs worked by the bed. The desk was small. The bed and bedding wasn‚Äôt very comfortable hence me staying elsewhere. Also the towels provided were dirty, one was the color of cream/grey and other had dark spots. Also the drain in the shower did not drain but the water pressure and heat were good. They did have extra towels and other things like toilet paper downstairs so that helped. I struggled with the outside lock and my room lock multiple times each time I entered. If I stayed for only a few nights like two, I would be fine. But if I were to stay longer, I‚Äôd look for other accommodations.
The room is clean. In the central area and very close to the place I need. Great experience

It‚Äôs a great value for a comfortable and safe stay. Phuong, the host, is friendly and responsive. Highly recommended!

It‚Äôs a rare moment during my years on Airbnb.
The photos made me decide to book this stay in the first place. But they cannot capture one thing: the feeling.
People said the feeling is the complex combination of many things, and for this one: the ambient light in the room shielding me from the cold hard rain outside; the decent scent welcoming me upon opening the door; the clean air with every breath. Together, they construct something simple yet profound: warmth.
The warmth on a busy street, in the heart of Saigon, on a raining day.
I find myself already eager for a return, soon.

Underneath the Room they running and pawing a Burger Restaurant which is also really tasty.
Ngoc is a very sweet and super friendly Host. I will definitely stay next time at her Place again .

Ngoc place is a great little find in a spacious room with large en-suite.
She was really helpful with some things I needed doing that relied on local knowledge.
Would definitely stay again.

The room was okay, but the bed was a little bit hard and had some stains. I also noticed a lot of dust under the bed, which was a bit off. The bed is too big giving small space to move. The stairs were extremely narrow, which made it difficult for me as a solo female traveler to carry all my heavy bags up to the 5th floor. In fact, my luggage got damaged because of it.
One unusual thing was that the toilet and bedroom were separate rooms. The toilet was connected to the kitchen, which was a shared space. This meant that when taking a shower, I couldn't just walk back to my room in a towel, as someone might be in the kitchen. It was a bit inconvenient and made me feel uncomfortable.
In terms of maintenance, the place could definitely use some fresh paint, and the kitchen and fridge were in need of a good cleaning.
Despite these issues, the location was great and the price was very affordable. I'm hopeful that the host will address these concerns to ensure the comfort of future guest.
I had an urgent schedule, so I stayed for a short time. Thanks to the host who willingly changed it, I returned home and finished my work well.

Michel is one of the best hosts I've met, going out of his way to meet my needs, and super responsive. The location is about 30-40 mins walk (1.5-2km) to city center (Nnuyan Hui promenade, Vincom mall, Train station, etc.) and it's close to Tan Dinh market and the pink church. The neighborhood is very local, for an authentic experience, but if you are looking for sth new, modern and international, you should considerD2/3 instead. There are tons of cafes, restos, supermarkets, massage parlors nearby. 20 mins to airport by car. The building has a locked gate downstairs so it feels safe, and it's quiet at night. For a 5-star review, I'd give Michel 10, my only complaint is the place is bit old and lack of maintenance, amenities look old and worn (such as the drain, sinks, aircon, etc.) and there's a certain stale smell which didn't change after they used air refresher. Overall it's good value for money for solo travelers/couples.

A really nice simple little studio located in a cute neighbourhood with lots of great little cafes and food options nearby (there's a friendly couple who sell banh great banh mi just outside the apartment which I highly recommend). It's pretty much the perfect distance from the busy city centre.
There's a gym just across the river called R·∫°ch Mi·ªÖu Gym Center which does cheap day passes if you need a place to workout during your stay, and there's also Le Van Tam Park if you want to go for a morning/evening run (you can also jog along the river).
Recommended for both tourist and longer stays.

The host Michel is super responsive and proactive, he really worked hard to make us feel comfortable here. I will recommend him and this place over and over! Merci beaucoup de nous recevoir, a bientot!

The host, Mic, is super friendly and supportive, made me feel like home.
Would love to stay here again & again every time I reach Saigon ‚ô•Ô∏è

Best spot in Saigon to see the city and most importantly eat! Best food ever within walking distance and great access to the river for coffee every day. Cannot recommend this place enough as a base from which to explore.

honestly I never wanted to leave the place. it was so comfortable and felt like home honestly after long day of being outside when we came it felt like home peaceful and can cook anything we want. lots of walkable juice places which was much needed in that heat was there and cafe and 7 eleven was in walkable distance so it was perfect. and the host was so sweet she even left us cup noodles in that busy time so that we don't have any issues.

This was one of the nicest airbnbs I‚Äôve ever stayed in! Such a cool space, feels very chic and spacious for a studio, and had everything you need to cook, chill etc.

We stayed here as a group of four friends on our first visit to Saigon, and this unit made our trip even more memorable. We arrived at midnight but getting here was easy since it‚Äôs just a bridge away from District 1. The residential complex felt homey, safe, and peaceful, with plenty of great food options nearby, plus a convenience store and ATM just around the corner. The space itself is beautiful ‚Äî exactly as shown in the photos and very clean and well-maintained. The only minor challenge we had was that it‚Äôs on the 3rd floor with no elevator, so we had to carry our luggage up, but we didn‚Äôt really mind. Mekong Lounge gave us a cozy, comfortable home base throughout our trip. The host, Le Thi My, is warm, kind, and very responsive ‚Äî she helped us with all our questions, gave great local recommendations, and made us feel welcome. We truly appreciated her hospitality and would happily stay here again and recommend her place to friends visiting Saigon!

We loved our stay at Mekong Lounge! The studio apartment was very spacious and had everything you could possibly need. Bathroom was clean and had a separate shower (not a wet one which was important to us)!! Water pressure is a little weak but nothing we couldn‚Äôt work with. Check in instructions included a video that made it super easy. Security was great as we were in a little communal area off the main road and the gates closed as night. Location was close to District 1 and so it was easy to get around via grab (5 minute ride or 15 minute walk but it‚Äôs really hot). Also super close to Com Tam Calamette which was our favourite meal during our time there!!! Overall we‚Äôd recommend :)

We had a great stay here! The place was so cosy & lovely & in a safe area. It was also really good in terms of sound- compared to many places around the city, it was very peaceful.
It was so awesome having a full set up for movies & games.
We did run in to the problem of having ants all over the kitchen & bathroom but the owner was so prompt & came over to clean & spray the areas within the same morning!
Also, the shower pressure wasn‚Äôt good but I can‚Äôt really fault it for that.
We had an amazing stay, if we‚Äôre back in the city we would absolutely stay again!
Thanks so much!

Staying at these apartments was an absolute pleasure! The space is roomy, cozy, and perfectly located just a short walk from the center of Saigon. The price is more than fair for what you get.
The real gem here is the gaming setup ‚Äî not only can you play on the TV, but there's also a full arcade machine packed with classic retro games! It's a super fun and nostalgic experience, and the controls are intuitive. We'd love to see a small booklet with tips and descriptions of the top games ‚Äî that would make it even more awesome ^__^
Everything else was great too: very clean, high-quality shampoo and shower gel in the bathroom, well-functioning air conditioner, and a large desk that's perfect for remote work. The only minor downside is carrying your luggage up to the third floor, as there's no elevator ‚Äî not a dealbreaker, just something to be aware of.
Highly recommend this place to any gamer or anyone who appreciates a fun and comfortable place to stay!

Host was very responsive and accommodating. The room itself was beautiful and clean. Loved the place!

The air-conditioning takes a while to cool the room, putting it on powerful mode helps. The traffic noise is a little jarring as the windows are not sound proof, but Hana mitigated that with ear plugs which softened the harsh sounds. Water heater is a little erratic, occasionally having hot water but more days we only had cold water. Use the kettle for warm baths. The service is really the best thing about the place honestly, as Hana and the building manager were very responsive to our every need. Otherwise, location is in the middle of a street that‚Äôs way too busy all the time. If you‚Äôre not on a budget, booking a hotel nearer to Takashimaya would be nicer. However for budget travellers, this airbnb does just fine,

Hana is quick to respond. There is washing machine and dryer for use, so you can wash your clothes conveniently. They do not provide detergent, but you can buy it yourself at the nearby convenience store.

I felt so comfortable and cared for in that moment and there was no expectation of money, though I made sure to show my appreciation with a tip and when I had been resting and unable to go out, she helped me set up the projector and made sure I could use the netflix. The place was great and in future I‚Äôll be back and staying in one of the bigger places when i‚Äôm back with my partner. The team were so responsive and the extra attention to detail when I was sick was such a relief for me. 10/5 stars for me. Looking forward to seeing Hannah when she comes to Australia! üíñ
